metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20321 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A race condition accessing file object in the Linux kernel OverlayFSsubsystem was found in the way users do rename in specific way withOverlayFS. A local user could use this flaw to crash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20321` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-242-generic - 4.4.0-242.276~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-242-generic - 4.4.0-242.276~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-242-lowlatency - 4.4.0-242.276~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1120-aws - 4.4.0-1120.126
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1129-azure - 4.15.0-1129.142~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-242.276~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1120.126').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1129.142~14.04.1').
